args: An unknown woman in a mourning dress appeared\nbefore Aldred and asked him to end her life.
Her behavior bewildered Aldred and Andromeda,\nwho believed she must have gone mad.
Hey, so that's a mourning dress, right?\nDid someone close to you die?
My husband. He and I worked\ntogether with the Syndicate.
So you ARE with the Syndicate!\nNo wonder you knew that damn name.
My husband and I were involved in\nthe Synthetic Shapeshifting Project.
The project that gave me this body!
I can see the hate you hold for me.\nUnleash that fury now. End me.
You ask for salvation after what you\ndid to me? Shameless. Pathetic!
And yet, it is all I can do.
Fine. In that case, tell me about yourself.\nEvery last detail. If I decide that you\ndeserve salvation, I'll give it to you.

My husband and I were employed in
research as to whether a certain kind
of magic could be used for medicinal
purposes.
Fusion magic—the combination of one\nliving creature with another to bring\nabout a wholly new organism.
My husband thought this magic might\nmake it possible to replace limbs lost\ndue to war or disease.
By which you mean you'd transfer\nlimbs from beasts to people, right?\nThat's a seriously sick idea.
Most believed as you do now,\nwhich is why his research was rejected.
Yes. He invited us to join the Syndicate,\nwith the promise we could continue\nour research uninterrupted.
It was an offer we could not refuse.
It did not take long for us to realize\nthe Syndicate was engaging in\npractices most inhumane.
But as we knew our research could\nbenefit countless numbers of people,\nwe did not stop.
What difference did seeing us make?
The Tf-series, created through the\nSynthetic Shapeshifting Project,\nwas the fusion of human and dragon.

The moment we saw you, we knew our
research would be twisted for evil ends
no matter how much positive potential
it might hold.
After that dark day, we changed\nthe direction of our research.
But soon thereafter, some of our\nexperimental subjects escaped.
My husband was killed in the chaos.\nLaid low by one of the escapees.
And by ＂one of the escapees,＂\nyou mean me.
I do. Which is why I want you to finish\nyour work. End me as you did him,\nthat I might join him in a new life.
Oh, this is all so sad.
Why not? Do you not hate me?\nDo you not seek to end all who\ntook the side of the Syndicate?
Oh, I hate you, all right. I hate you\nwith absolutely everything that I am.\nSo why would I give you salvation?
You can suffer until you drop dead\nin a ditch, lady. I don't give a damn.
Oh my gosh... It's practically\nbursting with mana!
If you do not honor my request, I will\ncause the mana in this sword to run wild.
It will easily destroy this entire town.\nWould you sacrifice so many simply\nto see me suffer a little longer?
Not gonna work, lady. What do I care if you\ndecide to wipe out a few random townies?
Wipe out the town. Hell, wipe out two!\nI'm still not going to kill you.
I have no other path to salvation.
If you do not do this thing,\nI will know endless suffering.
What are you going to do, Aldred?
That woman. She followed us here.\nWhat are you going to do about her?
She's locked herself in her room,\nbut she clearly still wants you to...\nyou know? Do that thing?
If being alive means she suffers,\nI hope she lives a thousand years.
She was with the Syndicate—I wouldn't\ngive her a cup of water if she was on fire.
(And yet, I was the one who wronged him\nfirst by taking his future and freedom.)
I know I have no right to salvation.
And yet, I wish it above all things.
